conclusion: Understanding the setup of the problem with a horizontal experimental platform, spring, slider, and circular arc track.
Listing given values: mass of slider, coefficient of kinetic friction, horizontal distance xBC, height of platform, radius of arc, angle θ, sin and cos of θ.
Objective is to find the angle between the velocity of the slider and the horizontal direction when it lands at point C.
Understanding the motion of the slider: ejected horizontally from point B, undergoes projectile motion, lands at point C.
Recalling that in projectile motion, velocity vector can be expressed in terms of horizontal and vertical components.
Horizontal component of velocity at B is vBx = vB, vertical component is vBy = 0.
During projectile motion, horizontal component remains constant, vertical component changes due to gravity.
At point C, velocity components are vCx = vB and vCy = -g*t (taking upward as positive).
Time of flight t can be determined from horizontal distance and horizontal velocity: t = xBC / vB.
Considering vertical displacement from B to C as h - hC.
Point C is on a circular arc track with radius R and angle θ, vertical displacement from O to C is R*cosθ.
Height of point C above the ground is h - (R - R*cosθ).
Vertical displacement from B to C is h - hC = 0.08 m.
